name: to-markdown
readme: # to-markdown An HTML to Markdown converter written in javascript. A basic implementation is there, but it's not yet fully bulletproof (contributions welcome!). ## Known issues There are a couple of known issues surrounding blockquotes in lists (and perhaps vice versa) — #2; and also how to handle HTML elements outside of the markdown subset (keep them/strip them?) — #3. ## Running under Node.js to-markdown can also be run under Node.js. Install it via NPM, and then: var toMarkdown = require('to-markdown').toMarkdown; console.log(toMarkdown('Hello world')); // Will output '**Hello world**' ### Unit tests Node.js unit tests can be run with NodeUnit: $ npm test This will test both server-side and client-side tests (using [zombie-qunit](https://github.com/bergie/zombie-qunit)). ## Licence to-markdown is copyright © 2011 [Dom Christie](http://domchristie.co.uk) and released under the MIT license.
